11*p43114a01124*turn over      (i) assuming that the wings act as a continuous conductor, explain why the wing tips become charged.(2)  (ii) identify which wing tip will become positive.  mark this on the diagram with an .(1)  (iii) once the aeroplane has reached a constant speed there is no further build up of charge.   explain why.(2)  (iv) the shape of the earth’s magnetic field is as though there were a bar magnet at the centre of the earth, aligned approximately on the north-south axis.   if the plane flies west to east, but above the equator, the wing tips do not become charged.   explain why.(2)(total for question 13 = 8 marks)
